Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

This is possible. You need to have a valid order.xml and then you specify i=
t
on the command line.
 
The following is Heritrix's command line usage hel=
p:
 
---
Usage: heritrix --help
Usage: heritrix --nowui ORDER.XML
Usage: he=
ritrix [--port=3D#] [--admin=3DLOGIN:PWRD] [--jmx[=3D#]] [--run]
[ORDER.XML=
]
Usage: heritrix [--port=3D#] --selftest[=3DTESTNAME]
Version: @VERSION@
O=
ptions:
 -a,--admin      Login and password for web user interface administ=
ration.
                 Default: admin/letmein.
 -h,--help       Prints th=
is message and exits.
 -j,--jmx        Start JMX. Allows remote control. De=
fault jmxmp port 8081.
 -n,--nowui      Put heritrix into run mode and begi=
n crawl using ORDER.XML.
Do
                 not put up web user interface.=

 -p,--port       Port to run web user interface on.  Default: 8080.
 -r,--=
run        Put heritrix into run mode. If ORDER.XML begin crawl.
 -s,--self=
test   Run the integrated selftests. Pass test name to test it
only
       =
          (Case sensitive: E.g. pass 'Charset' to run charset
selftest).
Ar=
guments:
 ORDER.XML       Crawl order to run.
---
 
So something along the =
lines of:
 
heritrix --nowui /myjob/order.xml 
 
should do the trick.
 
If =
you don't specify the --nowui (which eliminates the web UI) you need to
spe=
cify --run, or else the job will be held pending, until an operator
starts =
it via the WUI.
 
- Kris
 
P.s. I'm sure many on the list would be interest=
ed in knowning to which
purpose you are putting Heritrix, if you don't mind=
 sharing.

From: list1dism [mailto:list1dism@yah=
oo.com] 
Sent: 18. n=F3vember 2004 10:07
To: archive-crawler@...=
m
Subject: [archive-crawler] Controlling heritrix from the command prompt

=



Is there any way to create jobs and feed them to the crawler by the
comm=
and prompt? (that is without using the WUI)

To be more specific I want to =
create jobs from a particular profile by
giving the order.xml file of the p=
rofile I want to use as a command
parameter

The reason that I want to do t=
his, is to automate the whole process:
set some cron jobs that will create =
jobs and feed the crawler at
certain time schedules

You can point me to do=
cumentation on this matters, if answering here
would be too much for the li=
st

Thanks in advance
